subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|りょ}}
From {{bor|ja|ltc|-|sort=りょ}} {{m|zh|旅|tr=ljo{{sup|X}}||a military unit of 500 men; to go [on a sortie; on a trip or journey]}}.

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: The prefix usage only ever appears in kanji compounds.

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|たび}}
/tabi{{sub|1}}/ → /tabi/

From {{inh|ja|ojp|-|sort=たび}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Appears in the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'', completed no earlier than 759 and one of the oldest extant texts in the Japanese language.

May be cognate with {{m|ja|度|tr=tabi||the time when something happens}}; both terms have the same pitch accent, the same ancient vowel values, and some semantic overlap.

subSections.title: Noun
Verb
subSections.text:
{{ja-verb-suru|たび|tr=intrans}}

# to [[travel]], to [[go]] on a [[journey]] or [[trip]]
